title: Chapter 10 â€“ Practice: Sets and Basic Data Operations
description: Hands-on missions for chapter 10 using sets to handle unique items, remove duplicates, and compare groups.

solution.notes: Learner should turn a list of passwords into a set to remove duplicates, then print total vs unique counts and optionally the unique set.
Learner should use set union and intersection on two virus name sets and print viruses found by both and all viruses found.
Learner should find intersection of online and chat user sets, print who is in both, and use 'in' to check if a particular user is in chat.
Learner should convert a list with duplicates into a set, print both, and demonstrate a membership check like 'usb' in items_set.
